topic.title: Egress Path

body.p: The RI_RCP Egress path (source defects from a remote device) consumes packets from the 10GE port, and pushes the extracted APS_PCC and BDI/BEI/BIAE overhead data from inside the packets to the corresponding ODUC_TFRM stage and channel. The stage and channel are determined using the incoming Ethernet packets DA field which contains both the destination Framer Stage and Channel ID. The Device ID is also recovered from the Ethernet Packet and if it doesn’t match the locally configured Device ID the packet is thrown away. The APS level is recovered from PDU and is used to control the insertion into the appropriate APS level. An APS_PCC and BDI/BEI/BIAE overhead insertion enable is provided for each stage and channel.

The APS_PCC overhead is sent indirectly to the ODUC_TFRM via the OHP block and it is inserted using the ODUC_TFRM’s External OHP port. The BDI/BEI/BIAE overhead is however directly sent to the ODUC_TFRM using a dedicated RCP interface. The RI_RCP Egress path is a slave to both the ODUC_TFRM and OHP interfaces (i.e. receives OH requests and satisfies them) (internal only).

If OH requests by the ODUC_TFRM or OHP are made faster than the incoming rate of OH provided by the ENET packets or PDUs are no longer received from the Ethernet port (during an external FPGA upgrade for example):

li.p: BDI and APS_PCC will hold the previous value

body.p: If OH requests by the ODUC_TFRM or OHP are made slower than the incoming rate of overhead provided by the ENET packets:

ul.li: Last value of BEI, BDI, and APS_PCC is used
Previous value of BEI, BDI, and APS_PCC is thrown away

body.p: This Underflow and Overflow behavior described above is the same as DIGI 120 and DIGI-G4.

p.i: The RI_RCP Egress interfaces to the OHP and ODUC_TFRM have not changed since DIGI120/G4 with the exception of the Channel ID increasing from 7 to 8-bits. There are 6 dedicated RCP interfaces going to the OHP and also the ODUC_TFRM (one for each framer stage 1, 2, 3A, 3B, 4, N) (internal only).
The RI_RCP shall not support SM layer backwards information, FLEXO RPF, or DMti/DMp.
